title: How about this, Riot
body:
What I wanna say is  
IN RANKED GAMES' BANS/PICKS LOBBY, 
1. LET ALL THE PLAYERS IN THE TEAM VIEWING EACH OTHERS' LAST 3 OR W/E NUMBERS OF MATCHES KDA OR MATCH DETAILS,
2. AND MAKE  A VOTE BY ALL THE TEAMMATES TO DECIDE WHETHER THE BANS/PICKS SHOULD BE CONTINUED 
3. THE PLAYERS OF THE TEAM WHICH VOTED NOT TO CONTINUE PICKING WOULD BE RANDOMIZED AND MATCH AGAIN WITHOUT ANYONE GETTING PENALIZED

So the purposes are 
1. To make sure that no one in the team will get disappointed by the teammate who had already doing bad in those previous games WITHOUT knowing or noticing .
2. Although the previous matching details can be viewed online, but isn't it more convenient to view those information in game?
3. If someone in the team met a player who he doesn't want to work with due to these reasons ( negative attitude, unskilled, etc.), he can make a vote WHICH EVERYONE IN THE TEAM GETS A CHANCE TO MAKE DECISIONS instead of quit the game with LP losing. 

This was what happening in 14/1/2015,

I won 3 ranked matches in a row previously and I went into the promos of bo3 ( http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-history/NA/38683928 ) 

Then in the first promo, my team got a fiddlesticks ( http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/75467473/200036732?tab=overview ) who fed so hard and being negative and dragging the team down. 

For more details of the fiddle player, please click here ( http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=selari%20telorali )

As a result, I lost the first promo, and as soon as I get into the ban/pick lobby for my second promo, I met the fiddle again. What I did was quit the game instantly as I cannot allow that scene happens again.

And of course I failed my promotion to the next tier.

Maybe I am just unlucky but if there is something like what I said above in league, people would be much more enjoying the game but not suffering from unskilled players and negative players.

replies.body:
You need to stop blaming your team, when you lose be glad and see what you could have done better, you learn more from losses than wins, but you can't just say "oh this guy fed so I became powerless, it is his fault we lost" sometimes this may be true, but you need to ignore that and look at what **YOU** could have done better.

If you look to improve yourself, and not your team you will have a much easier time climbing.
